text: Bernard Bosson (25 February 1948 – 16 May 2017) was a French politician and lawyer. He served as Minister of Transport, Minister of Tourism, and Minister of Public Works under Prime Minister Édouard Balladur from 1993 to 1995. He was a member of the 12th French National Assembly, representing Haute-Savoie as a member of the Union for French Democracy. He was also the mayor of Annecy. Bosson died in hospital in Lyon, France on 16 May 2017 from a long- illness, aged 69. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:2017 deaths Category:People from Annecy Category:French mayors Category:Politicians from Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
